title: Chennai: Troubled by Jayalalithaa's health, man sets himself on fire
title_page: Chennai: Troubled by Jayalalithaa's health, man sets himself on fire - India News
text:
A 31-year-old man set himself on fire today as he was troubled by Tamil Nadu Chief Minister Jayalalithaa's health condition.
Sargunam later claimed that he was extremely depressed about Jayalalithaa still being in the hospital. The chief minister was admitted to Apollo hospital on September, 22. Periodical health bulletins have been released by the hospital which served as the only way of knowing about her health.
On Wednesday afternoon, Sargunam poured petrol and set himself on fire in front of Tambaram Sanitorium in Chennai. The cops who were on patrol tried to put the fire off but Sargunam tried to evade them. He was seen yelling, "There is no news about Amma's health. She should get well soon." Cops finally manged to handle him and put out the fire. Sargunam was immediately rushed to the hospital.

LIFE FOR AMMA
Sargunam's wife, Sheela said that he used to drink and rant such things often, so she didn't take it seriously but was taken back to hear that he set himself on fire. Sargunam who has severe burns in his hands, legs and chest, groaning in pain said, "I want to give my life and save Amma. Tamil Nadu needs her and she must get well soon."
Sargunam works as a security officer in a private company and has a 4-year-old daughter.

The incident created tension and drama on the busy road and disrupted traffic movement, while the commuters were shocked.
